page.title: 08CHURCHYARD
page.content: The churchyard has a most interesting gravestone not only in design but because of the story behind it. The grave is that of a poet William Ernest Henley, his wife Anna and his daughter Margaret Emma who died when she was only six. Although not a native of the area, family friends lived in the village and Margaret spent much of her childhood there and, when she died, her parents decided to bury her in a place she loved. Another family friend of the Henley's was the writer J.M.Barrie and he was especially fond of Margaret. She called him her FWENDY having difficulty saying FRIEND. When he wrote his most famous book 'Peter Pan' he called his character WENDY, in memory of his little 'FWENDY'.
